basics.name: Lara Schenck
basics.label: Prospective Ph.D. Student
basics.summary: Industry leader in web development seeking to transition from software engineering to computing education research.
interests: Unplugged CS for underserved adult learners
Broadening participation in computing through vocational training

research.summary: Independent research into what is a programming language vs. what developers think is a programming language. Invented the concept of CSS algorithms to promote inclusive understanding of programming.
highlights: Paper (draft): Is C more of a Programming Language that Python? Exploring Cognitive Bias In Programming Language Perception – Collaboration with Felienne Hermans to report results of an experimental survey.
Conferences: Presented research at conferences internationally from 2018-2019. Video here.

Workshop: Generative Art With FizzBuzz in CSS – Designed 1 hour workshop for intermediate-level high school students attending Code Day 2021 online. Developed pre-post survey to evaluate effectiveness of learning objectives.
Tutorials & Articles: CSS Is A Declarative, Domain-Specific Programming Language, Is CSS Turing Complete?, Writing CSS Algorithms

research.summary: At Penske Media Corporation, conceived of and implemented a front-end UI framework (design system) to speed up front-end development and reduce technical debt. Implemented the concept of CSS algorithms. This page is built with Larva.
highlights: Conducted need-finding interviews with engineers, designers, and product managers
Presented design system concepts and value proposition to executives; got buy-in
Created and tested prototypes to inform architecture
Implemented CSS algorithms as a core piece of the CSS architecture along with utility-forward CSS library
Conducted monthly "Larva Chats" with engineering and product for knowledge sharing and feedback collection
Outlined development of design system in informal blog post series entitled Designgineering Chronicles
Created proof-of-concept for visual regression testing; currently working to automate it
Devised and developed tools for product and designers to communicate more effectively with engineering using the system nomenclature

work.summary: Full stack web engineering for high-traffic, enterprise WordPress websites. Successfully led re-platform and upgrade initiatives across a network of 25 sites. Advocate for equity and inclusion in team culture, hiring, and compensation.
Compelling presentation of CSS algorithms research and educational topics at industry conferences.
highlights: Generative Art With FizzBuzz in CSS (invited) at CodeDay – online, 2021

work.summary: Developed curriculum and instructed web development in the forms of one-on-one tutoring, independently organized courses, and workshops for a variety of institutions.
highlights: University of Southern California, WordPress Development – Los Angeles, 2018
Girl Develop It, Workshop Instructor  – National, 2015-2018
Pratt Institute of Design, UI/UX Prototyping in Code and Coding I-II  – New York City, 2015-2016

work.summary: Contract front-end and WordPress development and training for startups and small to large businesses and web development agencies.

Support for the development of game-like curricular materials in the Mission Lab at Quest to Learn, a NYC public middle and high school that focuses on systems thinking and game-like learning. Collaborate with team of game designers and educators to produce digital and non-digital game assets.

volunteer.summary: Provide technical guidance and education for founder and returning citizen Andre Jacobs as he launches Supreme Network, a membership company that empowers inmates and returning citizens with mentorship, education, and financial opportunities.
Facilitate weekly meetings of the Core CSS team, devise and oversee and contribute code to long term projects improving the health and maintainability of the WordPress Core CSS code-base.

Participate in the core organizing group of the local Pittsburgh chapter of Showing Up for Racial Justice. Co-organized and led Racial Justice Muscle Building session focused on racial justice in tech.
Active member of local software development communities, volunteering time to mentor and tutor people entering the tech industry.
highlights: Learn Teach Code, Mentor – Los Angeles and online, 2017-Present
Global Diversity CFP Day, Co-Organizer – Pittsburgh, 2019
Write Speak Code, Mentor – Los Angeles 2017-2019
Global Diversity CFP Day, Mentor – Los Angeles, 2018
WordCamp LA, Volunteer coordinator and organized collaboration with Learn Teach Code – Los Angeles, 2018
CSS.la, Founder and organizer – Los Angeles, 2017-2019
CodePen Meetup NYC, Founder and organizer – New York City, 2014-2016
WordPress NYC, Regular presenter and mentor – New York City, 2014-2016

volunteer.summary: Development, ongoing maintenance, and technical advising for the C4AA on their WordPress website.

education.position: B.F.A. School of the Museum of Fine Arts at Tufts University
education.summary: Self-directed, studio-based curriculum focused in animation and game design; Elective coursework in Python Game Development and Reasoning & Critical Thinking; Internship in open source web development.
Fine Arts major with a focus in Printmaking; Transferred after sophomore year in order to have more flexibility in curriculum and opportunities to work in digital media.

hobbies: Independent study of programming languages and abstract math (category theory, graph theory, set theory, Standard ML, Rust, Elm, Future of Coding)
